perturbation.original_text: In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned agree to the joint filing on behalf of each of them of a statement on Schedule 13G (including amendments thereto) with respect to the Common Stock of Spring Bank Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
perturbation.changed_text: In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned agree to the joint filing on behalf of each of them of a notification on Schedule 13G (including amendments thereto) with respect to the Ordinary Shares of Spring Bank Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
perturbation.explanation: The contract uses 'statement' and 'notification' interchangeably. Also, 'Common Stock' and 'Ordinary Shares' may or may not refer to the same thing, creating ambiguity. If Common Stock and Ordinary Shares are referring to different things, it fundamentally changes the scope of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Each party to the agreement expressly authorizes each other party to file on its behalf any and all amendments to such statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party to the agreement expressly permits each other party to submit on its behalf any and all modifications to such notification.
perturbation.explanation: The contract uses 'authorizes' and 'permits' interchangeably, and replaces 'amendments' with 'modifications' and 'statement' with 'notification.' While seemingly synonymous, 'permits' could imply a lower level of authorization than 'authorizes.' 'Amendments' and 'modifications' might have different legal implications in the context of SEC filings.

perturbation.original_text: In evidence whereof, the undersigned have caused this Agreement to be executed on their behalf this 7t h day of April, 2020.
perturbation.changed_text: In witness whereof, the undersigned have caused this Accord to be signed on their behalf this 7t h day of April, 2020.
perturbation.explanation: The contract uses 'Agreement' and 'Accord' interchangeably, and replaces 'executed' with 'signed'. 'Signed' might imply a less formal acceptance than 'executed' which has a particular legal meaning.
